page.title: 03Shalford School 50 Years Ago
page.content: There was one large room, ie two classrooms back to back.There were separate playgrounds and cloakrooms for boys and girls. The children did reading, writing and arithmetic. Girls did knitting and boys gardening. Teeth and hair were checked monthly by{"Nitty Norah". Children bought sandwiches for lunch, usually dripping, jam or egg. Cocoa was sold at \d a cup when the kettle was put on the fire.There was no electricity so a tortoise stove and open fire heated the rooms. Water was fetched from a pump. Later, mains water was connected to a tap over a sink. The toilets were buckets. Twice a week a man dug a hole in the ground and emptied them. For toilet paper, newspaper squares were used. These were cut by children as a punishment.
